Tornadoes also possible, mainly near the Bay. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EekNj84U0AE4NGj.png

RT @AdamShawNY Sen. @TedCruz is today chairing a Senate hearing to highlight the role Antifa and others are playing in recent riots across the country -- warning that radical groups are engaging in "organized terror attacks" against government institutions. https://www.foxnews.com/politics/antifa-cruz-riots-organized-terror-attacks

3 in 4 Americans—including 58% of Republicans—support requiring mask wearing.

We have got to make high-quality masks free for everyone in this country.

It's time to listen to the American people and save lives. Congress must pass our Masks for All Act: https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/2020/08/04/bernie-sanders-coronavirus-masks-for-all-health-column/5571903002/

In the richest country in the world, no one should ever have to make a choice between food and medication they need to survive.

Time is of the essence. We must extend the $600 weekly unemployment benefit right away. 
https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/08/02/heals-act-stimulus-bill-clock-ticking-many-americans/5537530002/

Anthony Tata has no business working in the Pentagon in any capacity. His vile Islamophobic comments are disqualifying, period.

Our service members deserve better from their leadership. https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/02/politics/anthony-tata-nominee-pentagon/index.html

RT @JonathanTurley Today I am testifying in the Senate Judiciary Committee on “The Right of the People Peaceably to Assemble: Protecting Speech by Stopping Anarchist Violence.” The hearing will be held at 2:30 and will be broadcast on C-Span. My testimony is now posted. https://jonathanturley.org/2020/08/04/turley-testifies-in-senate-on-antifa-and-the-anti-free-speech-movement-in-the-united-states/

RT @AriFleischer Ever since Biden said, “you ain’t black” his staff holds its breath on those infrequent days when he does take Qs.  There’s not enough bubble wrap to protect Biden from himself. https://twitter.com/JasonMillerinDC/status/1290436831268483079 QT @JasonMillerinDC .@realDonaldTrump answered 17 questions from reporters today & at least 220 q’s from reporters since July 19.

Joe Biden answered NO questions from reporters today & only 36 q’s from reporters since July 19 - and none since July 28.

Why is the media covering for Joe Biden???

Making sure that every American has a high-quality mask, and wears it, is an important step forward in combatting this horrific pandemic. Every day we delay providing masks for all, lives are needlessly lost. https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/2020/08/04/bernie-sanders-coronavirus-masks-for-all-health-column/5571903002/

TODAY at 2:30pm ET / 1:30pm CT as chairman of the Subcommittee on The Constitution I will convene a hearing to discuss how #Antifa and other anti-American anarchists engage in riots and violence.
 
Livestream will be available here --> https://www.facebook.com/SenatorTedCruz http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EelT5UsWkAkH3dT.png

If you need a ride to the polls text "RIDE" to 314-370-2929.

If you see any possible voter suppression call 1-866-OUR-VOTE.

#MO01, go vote💜

This morning I joined ⁦@hughhewitt⁩ to discuss #TikTok & the need to help prevent unemployment by passing another round of #PPP 

Listen here: https://www.hughhewitt.com/wp-content/uploads/08-04hhs-rubio.mp3

Kodak (yes, the film company) got a big government contract to make generic COVID-19 drugs. Surprise: @Kodak’s trading volume spiked before the announcement. Even Kodak’s chairman bought stock. I want the SEC to investigate for possible insider trading. https://www.rollcall.com/2020/08/04/warren-asks-sec-about-insider-trading-in-trumps-kodak-pharmaceuticals-announcement/

I am proud to stand with @PramilaJayapal today, in November, and in the many fights to come. From taking on corruption, to standing up to racism and xenophobia, to protecting workers' rights, Pramila is a progressive champion that our country can always depend on.

We need proven progressive leaders in Congress to call out corruption and stand up for the people. From taking on special interests in the coal, oil, and the chemical industries to standing up to the wealthy and well-connected, @BethDoglio has shown she’s one of those leaders.

As City Treasurer, @Tishaura has been laser focused on serving working families in St. Louis and has been on the front lines of the fight to reduce the racial wealth gap. I’m proud to support her re-election and know she'll continue to improve the lives of the people she serves.

.@NicoleRGalloway has spent her career taking on corrupt politicians and special interests—and winning. I’m proud to support her because I know she’ll do the same as Missouri's next governor. Missouri deserves a leader who fights for working families—not the special interests.

After working as a teacher, then building a career helping small businesses grow, @JillSchupp first got into politics as a mom fighting for public schools. And during her time in the state legislature, she's proven she's the leader Missourians need. Let's send her to Congress!

I hope St. Louis will re-elect @VoteGardner2020 as Circuit Attorney. Kim won’t back down in the fight for social, racial, and economic justice. She's fought to address the root causes of crime and has been a leader in police accountability and rolling back mass incarceration.

I know that @HillaryScholten will make real and lasting change for the people of West Michigan. She's a civil rights attorney fighting every day to make her neighbors' lives a little bit better—and I can't wait to help continue those fights arm in arm with her in Congress.

We need tenacious fighters like @lpohutsky19 in our state legislatures to make big, structural change. During her first term, Laurie championed working families, fought relentlessly to protect seniors, and worked to make health care affordable for every Michigander.

As a single mother of five, fourth generation Detroiter, and housing organizer, @Roslyn4StateRep understands the needs of Michigan’s 9th House District—especially during this moment of crisis—and I know that she will be a powerful advocate for all working families.

.@Andy_Levin is an incredible partner in the fight for big, structural change. From his leadership on labor law reform, education equity, and green infrastructure to his work to give families a fighting chance during this crisis, Andy is an indispensable champion for the people.

I'm proud to support my friend and colleague @GaryPeters in his run for re-election. From our work together to pass critical financial reforms to our shared fight to lower prescription drug costs, I’ve seen firsthand just how dedicated he is to putting working families first.

Kansas deserves progressive fighters—and that’s exactly who @RuiXuKS is. I’m proud to support his re-election to the Kansas House. Rui will stand up for the vulnerable, fight climate change, and make sure Kansas never returns to the days of Sam Brownback.

Let's send @ShariceDavids back to the House—where her voice is needed more than ever. She’s been a champion for working families in her first term, fighting to lower the cost of prescription drugs, root out corruption, and end the epidemic of gun violence in this country.

Our mayors are on the front lines every day for our cities, and we need that knowledge and strength in Congress now more than ever. As Mayor of Topeka, @Dasharyl has been fighting for her family, for her community, and for her city—and now, she wants to fight for her state.

Real change starts at the local level—and that's why Arizonans should be sure to send former Teacher of the Year @ChristinePMarsh to the State Senate. She knows firsthand what it's like to teach in Arizona's public schools, and she’ll fight for students and educators.

Arizona, Kansas, Michigan, Missouri, and Washington—it’s Election Day, and there are some incredible Democrats on today’s ballots that need your support. 

Read up on them below, and be sure to get out there today (safely) and make your voice heard: http://IWillVote.com

.@NationalNurses in my community CONSTANTLY communicate how housing is a major determinant of health.

A wave of evictions + housing instability means yet another crush on our healthcare system.

We must do whatever we can to guarantee housing during this pandemic (& overall!) https://twitter.com/lpolgreen/status/1290642508402364416 QT @lpolgreen Getting evicted is one of the most searing life experiences. It happened to my family once and it was the most destabilizing event in a childhood filled with instability. This will wreck people.  https://apnews.com/833d91877e2f0fa913c5258978a9e83c

Three things to consider before kids resume playing sports, according to a physician https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/2020/08/04/three-things-consider-before-kids-resume-playing-sports-according-physician/

PREVIEW of today’s @senjudiciary hearing reported by @AdamShawNY: Cruz will chair a hearing to investigate groups such as #Antifa, which, while active for years, have recently escalated their presence in the wake of George Floyd's death in police custody.

Another dramatic drop in new #COVID19 cases in #Florida today. 

Since test results take several days it’s not clear how much the lower numbers of last three days is the result of three day closures of state-run testing sites due to storm.

RT @SenBobCasey Over 40% of #COVID19 related deaths nationwide have been residents and workers in long-term care settings. Proud to work with my friend and colleague @SenWarren to fight for policies that support our most at-risk populations--including funding for #Medicaid and #HCBS. https://twitter.com/SenWarren/status/1290435552949547016 QT @SenWarren Almost 800,000 seniors & people with disabilities are on wait lists for home-based care through Medicaid. Without it, many will be forced into nursing homes during this pandemic. @SenBobCasey & I are leading our colleagues in urging McConnell to fund HCBS in the next relief bill. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EeiL--TUcAA6xyh.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EeiL_AmUcAAoFNF.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EeiL-5rVAAAdvy2.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EeiL-8BU4AAy8OK.png

RT @JonathanTurley Today I am testifying in the Senate Judiciary Committee on “The Right of the People Peaceably to Assemble: Protecting Speech by Stopping Anarchist Violence.” The hearing will be held at 2:30 and will be broadcast on C-Span. My testimony is now posted. https://jonathanturley.org/2020/08/04/turley-testifies-in-senate-on-antifa-and-the-anti-free-speech-movement-in-the-united-states/

Donald Trump and his partisan cheerleader of a Postmaster General are trying to undermine the postal service. 

Congress must shore up the USPS so everyone can continue to receive the essential supplies they need, and so as many Americans as possible can safely vote from home.

More and more people are starting to realize that baby bonds are a pragmatic way to deal with the economic inequity in our society.

By investing in our children, we can seriously address intergenerational poverty and close the racial wealth gap. 
https://www.nj.com/opinion/2020/07/how-best-to-lift-prospects-of-african-americans-cory-booker-has-a-compelling-plan-thats-gaining-traction-moran.html

Before congratulating Comrade Cuomo read this article which details how NY government red tape and cronyism prevented newly created hospitals from taking care of patients. https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/opinion/new-yorks-failure-to-use-emergency-hospitals-is-another-reason-to-distrust-government-healthcare

RT @SenTedCruz Every American has the right to peaceably assemble & exercise free-speech. They don’t have the right to commit acts of violence or crimes.

Today I’ll chair a hearing to examine the role #Antifa and other anarchists have played in the violence we’ve seen. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1290657285103128585/img/IOHJVq2rVTU0qWvt.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1290657285103128585/vid/480x270/ztpvf95JFRFy2xvE.mp4?tag=13

We need an urgent course correction to face the worst shrinkage in our economy in generations, jobless claims topping 1 million for weeks, and a surge of #TrumpVirus cases across our country. 

America’s working families need help more than ever right now.

RT @PramilaJayapal Go vote! Happy primary day to everyone across Washington. Get your ballot postmarked TODAY or put it in a drop box location by 8:00 p.m. Make your voice heard! https://twitter.com/TheStranger/status/1290414338264543232 QT @TheStranger As of Monday morning, only 27 percent of King County voters had returned ballots: "It will be interesting to see what drop box returns look like today and tomorrow, as we’ve seen such huge Monday and Tuesday usage of those in recent elections."
https://www.thestranger.com/slog/2020/08/03/44213880/the-primary-is-tomorrow-statewide-turnout-is-high-king-county-is-still-lagging

RT @EdMarkey The first round of ballots are arriving in mailboxes across Massachusetts. That means for thousands of people, election day is today. There’s no time to waste to get out the vote. Sign up for a shift at https://edmarkey.us/onemonth.

Over 155,000 Americans have died from coronavirus and Trump argues it’s not so bad.

Let’s end this national nightmare in 91 days by electing @JoeBiden. 
http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1290456533667586049/img/Pb2xmJl3pARYeRnk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1290456533667586049/vid/480x270/nxQI_C0v71GpvZjC.mp4?tag=13

We must pass a $50 billion child care bailout to save our child care system from collapsing. We must get our schools the funding they need. And we must have a national plan to contain this virus so kids can safely return to school and moms (and dads) can safely go back to work.

I felt like a failure trying to juggle my young kids & teaching job. If schools & child care had closed & my Aunt Bee had to social distance, I would’ve quit. I wouldn’t be here in the Senate today.

We can't let that happen to this generation of moms.
https://19thnews.org/2020/08/americas-first-female-recession/

This is why I keep saying #DontCancelOctober. We have the real promise of new therapies very soon that while not a cure will dramatically change the outcome for COVID-19 patients & provide us more flexibility to return to school,work & life 

 https://www.nih.gov/news-events/news-releases/nih-launches-clinical-trial-test-antibody-treatment-hospitalized-covid-19-patients#.Xymf53w2FCA.twitter

RT @SenTedCruz TODAY at 2:30pm ET / 1:30pm CT as chairman of the Subcommittee on The Constitution I will convene a hearing to discuss how #Antifa and other anti-American anarchists engage in riots and violence.
 
Livestream will be available here --> https://www.facebook.com/SenatorTedCruz http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EelT5UsWkAkH3dT.png

This is a very positive trend in the county with by far the most #COVID19 cases. 

Hoping that it continues. https://twitter.com/conarck/status/1290688971434086400 QT @conarck Miami-Dade: The number of COVID+ patients in county hospitals is plateauing. Discharges (170) are outpacing new patients added (130) again as of this morning. 503 of the 1,936 COVID patients are in ICUs, -4 over yesterday. Fire Rescue call 5-day avg: 118. https://www.miamidade.gov/information/library/2020-08-04-new-normal-dashboard.pdf http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EelyxUOXkAE3cyJ.png
Intel’s Stumble Is Very Bad for America https://americancompass.org/intels-stumble-is-very-bad-for-america/ via @AmerCompass

Good. If investors or @Kodak employees were trading based on the unauthorized disclosure or discussion of nonpublic information, then it would appear to be a clear violation of securities law. The SEC should hold them accountable. https://twitter.com/WSJ/status/1290689637732823041 QT @WSJ The SEC is investigating how Kodak disclosed a government loan and the stock trades made close to the announcement, people familiar with the matter say https://trib.al/VunMn2Z

RT @Julio_Rosas11 Sen. @tedcruz: Those rioters aren’t concerned about racial justice...Their actions are profoundly racist, the rioters, as they destroy minority communities, minority businesses, and minority lives across this country...Peaceful protests must be protected. Riots must be stopped. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1290721509384781824/pu/img/DgmSLSfX_MWB8GJM.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1290721509384781824/pu/vid/480x270/NxHyxxqZ8-CsPC_t.mp4?tag=10

Meatpacking companies like Smithfield are putting their workers in harm’s way in order to maximize profits. Tens of thousands of workers across the industry have been infected with #COVID19 as a result. It’s clear that these companies can’t be trusted to do what is right. https://twitter.com/leahjdouglas/status/1289966510329303041 QT @leahjdouglas I just opened my Sunday NYT to see a full page ad from @SmithfieldFoods accusing its “critics” (e.g. the press, at least in part) of spreading “false narratives,” “misinformation,” and “disinformation” about its Covid-19 response. I have, unsurprisingly, some thoughts on that. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eebhs-0WkAE3rna.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eebhs-0XoAAv-JE.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eebhs-4XYAA4iml.jpg

I hope today’s @senjudiciary Subcommittee on The Constitution hearing is a step toward recognizing the threat of political violence groups like #Antifa poses to our country.
 
Watch live here:
📺 https://www.facebook.com/SenatorTedCruz
📺 https://www.c-span.org/schedule/?utime=1596557163

Maduro is being propped up by Russia, China, and Cuba—using Venezuela as a playground for nefarious activities. We must get serious about dissuading these bad actors from pursing their current course, starting with an unequivocal recognition of Guaido as the legitimate President. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1290722066304503811/img/llwwa9X8IGnnTrel.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1290722066304503811/vid/480x270/FNVKrdRBZSNbdA6W.mp4?tag=13

Millions more Americans are heading to the polls today and Congress still hasn't passed legislation to ensure voting is safe and accessible during this pandemic.
 
We can't wait any longer. It's time to pass my VoteSafe Act so no one risks their health to cast their ballot.

Americans have a right to peaceably protest. They do not have a right to engage in violence & anarchy. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1290687279783194625/img/BrJ2V0TG4fs-Oy2A.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1290687279783194625/vid/480x270/H0nvgznOlFVJHwLD.mp4?tag=13

Peaceful protests must be protected. Riots must be stopped. No one has the right to assault another person, to firebomb a building, to throw a Molotov cocktail into a police car. That’s not exercising a constitutional right—that’s terrorizing your fellow citizens.

Dictator Nicolás Maduro is closely watching the outcome of the 2020 U.S. elections. His narco-regime doesn't have Congress' support; there's bipartisan consensus on the threat posed to the U.S. and our regional allies by this organized crime syndicate. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1290735975019286528/pu/img/xs2VHkpzCPpupLyI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1290735975019286528/pu/vid/320x320/8ESosGZqUi2uT6Mo.mp4?tag=10

RT @thehill Sen. @TedCruz critiques Sen. Mazie Hirono's video: "At the end of that video, that as narrated it describes law enforcement officers as 'unidentified' while the video shows them with the words 'POLICE' in bright yellow all-caps across their chest." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EemVx5SWkAYrTlb.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1290726954019295232/vid/478x270/NbZwfXSYih6N2FeS.mp4?tag=13

RT @DailyCaller .@SenTedCruz opened up the Senate subcommittee hearing on Antifa by playing this video 
 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1290722679838908416/pu/img/PiIDulE86g-xcZKw.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1290722679838908416/pu/vid/486x270/PefbDnVixchpe2zK.mp4?tag=10

If we want to reopen the economy and have our children safely back in school, we have to defeat the #TrumpVirus.

The House provided a strategic plan to do that more than 11 weeks ago. But Washington Republicans are failing the American people.

Today @JoeBiden released his plan for the Latinx community to ensure they can thrive not just at work but at schools and beyond. I'm joining @MSNBC at 4pm ET to discuss this and more.
https://twitter.com/JoeBiden/status/1290675360682500096 QT @JoeBiden The Latino community is bearing disproportionate harm from this pandemic.
